bug.short_desc: my macbook says to "service battery". also has a messed up display

long_desc.thetext:
My macbook has been shutting itself down randomly while on battery power. The built in power indicator will show >50%. Looking at the help entry it says
Service Battery: The battery isn’t functioning normally, and you may or may not notice a change in its behavior or the amount of charge it holds. Have your computer checked by an Apple Authorized Service Provider (AASP). You can continue to use your battery before it’s checked without harming your computer.
Does fixing this require my machine to be sent it or is it something that I am ok to take to an apple store for?
Thanks,
John
We can get you a new battery. Whatkind of macbook do you use?

(In reply to comment #1) > We can get you a new battery. Whatkind of macbook do you use?
MacBookPro5,2 with 17" screen and Core 2 Duo.
From System Profiler ========================================================================= Model Name: MacBook Pro Model Identifier: MacBookPro5,2 Processor Name: Intel Core 2 Duo Processor Speed: 2.8 GHz Number Of Processors: 1 Total Number Of Cores: 2 L2 Cache: 6 MB Memory: 4 GB Bus Speed: 1.07 GHz Boot ROM Version: MBP52.008E.B05 SMC Version (system): 1.42f4 Serial Number (system): W89430YW8YA Hardware UUID: 71EB2072-0DE6-5352-85A7-90DA0DBDBB0F Sudden Motion Sensor: State: Enabled
The unibodys have to go to Apple to get the battery repaired. John, if you need we can setup a loaner for you and send your machine in.
Sure. Can I have a macbook air as a loaner (contemplating getting an air for hardware refresh someday)?
Spencer loaned a macbook air loaner last Monday. You could stop by desktop and bring in your old machine for service by Apple.

(In reply to comment #5) > Spencer loaned a macbook air loaner last Monday. You could stop by desktop and > bring in your old machine for service by Apple.
Actually, it wasn't last monday (this bug was filed last wednesday). I am securely erasing my hard drive before sending the machine in. That is running over the weekend and I will drop the machine off once I check that it is done tomorrow (monday).

I am going to drop off this computer. Late last week, the computer screen went all grey and it looked like every other line went off (like one field turning off on an interlaced display). I wonder if there is something more than the battery going bad.
I'm reimaged this machine to see what else is wrong and I will call Apple to get this shipped and fixed.
the screen thing has only happened once, so i don't know how repeatable it is.
